STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 21, 2021
Kathleen Sperling
Arenac County DHHS
3709 Deep River Road
Standish, MI 48658
RE: License #: CP060200953
Arenac County DHHS
3709 Deep River Road
Standish, MI 48658
Dear Ms. Sperling:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
April 12 – 16, 2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 For repeat violations, why the prior CAP failed to achieve compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact, Claudia Triestram, area manager at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara Cote, Licensing Consultant WOC
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12328 Foster home record.
(2) The record shall contain all of the following information:
(e) Any written response from a foster parent, as
provided by R 400.12327(6)(b).
One of two closed foster care files reviewed lacked documentation from the foster
parent requesting to close their foster care license.
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(1) There shall be a mutually agreed upon contract between the
youth and the agency specifying all of the following:
(d) The location where the youth is living.
One of one independent living file reviewed lacked documentation of the location
where the youth was living on the contract.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.33 SERVICE PLAN SIGNATURES
c) Service Plans shall be signed by the caseworker, the caseworker’s
supervisor, the parent(s), and the child(ren), if of age to participate.
Documentation shall be provided for a missing signature and a plan
shall be documented to secure their participation in services.
One of three open foster care case files reviewed lacked a signature from the
caseworker.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-06H Timely Entry of Caseworker Contacts
All face-to-face contacts must be entered in MiSACWIS within five
business days of the contact.
4

One of three open foster care files reviewed lacked face-to-face contacts being
entered within five business days.
FOM 722-16 Young Adult Monthly Visit Report
Young Adult Monthly Visit Report must be completed with the youth
during each home visit. A copy must be given to the youth and the
original placed in the case record.
One of one open care file lacked one monthly visit report.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
No technical assistance was requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
No consultation was requested of required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were zero incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Staff members interviewed reported feeling supported by their peers as well as
upper management. Staff members reported getting regular training, being able to
easily reach their supervisor and having the resources to do their jobs.
The analyst reported not having any safety concerns from the homes visited. The
analyst reported that licensed and unlicensed homes reported feeling supported and
heard by the agency.
Documents that were lacking from the case files were often completed but not
uploaded into MiSACWIS resulting in the citations. Service plans were detailed,
showed follow through from one plan to the next and were not cookie cutter.
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
April 21,2021
________________________________________
Barbara Cote Date
Licensing Consultant WOC
Approved By:
April 21, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
